content.description:
Sit start with both of your hands on the obvious, right-facing jug or with your left hand a hold higher. Continue up and slightly left on small crimps, and then pull over the lip on a jug. Beta tip 5 lines below... don't look if you don't want to know ;-)

1

2

3

4

5

Beta tip: sink your right heel behind the starting jug, and turn your toe down. When you get it right, it will help you through the crimps, all the way to the last two, and make them pretty easy to hold. Enjoy!
content.location:
It is on an overhanding face just off the upper trail to the right 50-100 feet before the

The Lorax

. See the beta photo with the view from trail.

content.description: The Lorax ascends a beautiful, south-facing slab with slopey holds with great rock quality.
content.location: Climb a short, left-to-right/diagonal traverse, then go straight up a vertical face on slopers.
